title: ADVISORY: President Obama to Discuss Importance of Fatherhood and Personal Responsibility | whitehouse.gov
content:
The White House




June 19, 2009

 



ADVISORY: President Obama to Discuss Importance of Fatherhood and Personal Responsibility






THE WHITE HOUSE
		 

		Office of the Press Secretary
		___________________________________________________________________
		For Immediate Release                                              June 19, 2009


ADVISORY: President Obama to Discuss Importance of Fatherhood and Personal Responsibility
		 

		WASHINGTON - Today, President Obama is scheduled to begin a national conversation on responsible fatherhood and healthy families with a series of events designed to illuminate the importance of fatherhood and mentorship and how dads are strengthening themselves, their families and their communities.
		 

		EVENT DETAILS

		1:00 PM - Visits to Area Non-Profit Organizations
		The President’s visit is pooled press. All other visits are open press, but space is limited.  All riser space has been allocated.
		Set Time: 12:30 PM

		President Obama and participating fathers and mentors will pair up and visit Washington area non-profit organizations that focus on youth mentorship.

		Non-Profit Sites & Participants
		 
		Life Pieces to Master Pieces
		DeWayne Wade – Miami Heat & Reggie Love – White House Staff

		Falcon’s Edge
		Antwan Randle El – Washington Redskins & Greg Brown – President and CEO, Motorola Corporation

		Arch Training Center
		U.S. Senator Evan Bayh & Etan Thomas – Washington Wizards

		Asian American LEAD
		BD Wong – Tony Award Winning Actor & Dr. Steve Rosen – Northwestern Cancer Center

		Latin American Youth Center
		Tony Hawk – Professional Skateboarder & Jorge Ramos – Reporter/Anchor, Univision

		Covenant House
		Dr. Robert Franklin - President, Morehouse College & Denis McDonough – White House Staff

		Gospel Rescue Mission
		Bobby Flay – Award winning chef & Michael Strautmanis – White House Staff

		Ballou Automotive Technology Center (Ballou Senior High School)
		Bill Cowher – Former NFL coach & Darryl McDaniels of Run DMC – Legendary Hip Hop Artist

		 
		2:45 PM - Town Hall on Fatherhood
		Open press, but space is limited.  All riser space has been allocated
		East Room (Pre-set 1:15PM – Final Gather 2:25PM – North Doors of the Palm Room)

		Upon returning to the White House, President Obama will participate in a conversation on fatherhood in the East Room featuring five fathers from a diversity of backgrounds discussing their personal stories and commitment to fatherhood and personal responsibility.  The session will also include questions from the audience.

		Participants:
		Juan Carlos Artero - Arlington, VA
		Young father, graduate of model transitional jobs organization

		Joe Jones - Baltimore, MD
		Ex-substance abuser and offender, founder and President of the Center for Urban Families, one of the nation’s leading fatherhood and family programs

		Mike Laas, Bettendorf, IA
		An everyday dad working together with his wife to support their family

		Chief Quartermaster John Lehnen, U.S. Navy
		Military dad with four children including a set of triplets

		Etan Thomas, Washington Wizards
		Celebrity father balancing work, family and community service

		 
		4:00 PM – Mentoring Session with Washington, DC Area Youth
		Open press, but space is limited.  All riser space has been allocated
		South Lawn (Pre-set 1:45PM – Final Gather 3:40PM – North Doors of the Palm Room)

		The final event of the day has fathers, mentors and DC area youth participating in activities on the White House South Lawn.  President Obama will open this event, which will include mentoring sessions and other activities.

		To reserve space, you must RSVP by 10:00 AM EDT TODAY to media_affairs@who.eop.gov and list all of the events you wish to attend in the subject line of your email.

		For more information on this event, contact White House Media Affairs Office at 202-456-6238.
